thread.title: Tweens: The Hardest Hotel Customers to Please

author: Andrea Petersen
title: Tweens: The Hardest Hotel Customers to Please
text:
Hotels are trying to crack one of the trickiest riddles in the business: How do you keep a tween happy?
Children in that awkward age between 8 and 12 can be a headache for hotels. They flee at the sight of 5-year-olds coloring. Yet they may be too young to wander around a resort alone or to take part in the growing number of teen-oriented activities at hotels like dance parties.
